subject: Relationships
title: Friendship and Social Media Paradox
description: A 60-second lesson on Friendship and Social Media Paradox.

hook.text: You have 800 Facebook friends and feel lonelier than your grandmother who has three friends and no phone.

buildup.text: Social media creates 'ambient awareness' â€” knowing about friends' lives without actual interaction.

discovery.text: Studies show passive scrolling decreases well-being, while active messaging increases it. Use determines impact.

twist.text: Social media maintains weak ties brilliantly. But it can't build the deep intimacy that prevents loneliness.

climax.text: The platform is neutral. How you use it decides whether it connects you or isolates you further.

punchline.text: Social media maintains acquaintances. It can't build best friends.

quiz.question: What determines whether social media helps or hurts friendships?
